Clip.Title: LIONS IN BATTLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: After a harsh season, the lionesses of The Okavango Delta in southern Africa struggle to feed their cubs, often entering enemy territory to find food to save their pride.

Clip.Title: TURF WAR: LIONS AND HIPPOS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The merciless dry season has scorched Africa's Luangwa Rift Valley and ignited an extraordinary battle between the king of beasts and their three-ton foes. Here on the banks of a dwindling river, lions and hippos fight for territory along this last source of life, a clash that grows more heated as the water level continues to drop. Enter a world where deadly force meets lethal power, where cubs and calves become collateral damage, and where a bull's fearsome leadership and a mother lion's devotion set the stage for a true-life drama.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet performs revolutionary surgical techniques to save the lives of his four legged patients. See Oscar the cat get a bionic foot transplant and Mayo the arthritic dog, an "X-Men" inspired surgical procedure.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: About the size of Texas, the island country of Papua New Guinea sits just to the North of Australia. At Papua's far eastern tip lies Milne Bay - holding one of the planet's highest concentrations of marine species.

Clip.Title: LIONS IN BATTLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: After a harsh season, the lionesses of The Okavango Delta in southern Africa struggle to feed their cubs, often entering enemy territory to find food to save their pride.

Enter a world where deadly force meets lethal power, where cubs and calves become collateral damage, and where a bull's fearsome leadership and a mother lion's devotion set the stage for a true-life drama.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This West-African nation is among the most-affected nations on Earth from Climate Change as drought starves its people.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Here on the banks of a dwindling river, lions and hippos fight for territory along this last source of life, a clash that grows more heated as the water level continues to drop. Enter a world where deadly force meets lethal power, where cubs and calves become collateral damage, and where a bull's fearsome leadership and a mother lion's devotion set the stage for a true-life drama.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' videos show flights endangered by various forces of nature, and raise questions about how prepared we really are to fly against the elements.

Clip.Title: CIVIL WAR 360
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a journey back in time and immerse yourself in a 150-year-old battle that nearly split our nation in two. This three-part series explores famous and little known aspects of the Civil War, from the perspectives of the Union, the Confederacy and the millions of enslaved people struggling for freedom. Hosted by Ashley Judd, Trace Adkins, and Dennis Haysbert, all of whom had ancestors greatly affected by the war, this series delivers fresh insights and untold tales, brought to life through dramatic recreations and the Smithsonian Institution's vast collection of artifacts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey over New Brunswick's Bay of Fundy coastline explores geological wonders, the loyalist city of Saint John and international borders beyond and one of the world's most famous waterways.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: KURU: SCIENCE AND THE SORCERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Australian researcher discovers the cause of a crippling plague in New Guinea, and finds how the affliction the isolated tribe suffers from became a global concern.

Clip.Title: BAD BLOOD: A CAUTIONARY TALE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: See how a 'miracle' treatment became an agent of death, and how a community launched a fight to right the system that failed them to make it safer for all.

Clip.Title: THE VACCINE ACCORDING TO BILL GATES
Clip.Episode: The Vaccine According to Bill Gates
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Malaria kills between one and three million people each year, and almost 500 million are contaminated with the disease throughout the world. For the past 80 years, researchers have been unsuccessful at finding a cure. However, we may be about to witness a breakthrough.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: KURU: SCIENCE AND THE SORCERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Australian researcher discovers the cause of a crippling plague in New Guinea, and finds how the affliction the isolated tribe suffers from became a global concern.

Clip.Title: BAD BLOOD: A CAUTIONARY TALE
